intro: Rubus timbal-lagravei proles rigidulus, commonly known as the rigid-stemmed bramble, is a species of flowering plant in the Rosaceae family. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits known as drupes, which are typically red or black in color. It thrives in temperate regions with well-drained soil and partial shade. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
